roleset.name: exit, leave

example.name: transitive
example.text: As a result, UAL's chairman, Stephen M. Wolf, pulled out of the buy-out effort to focus on running the company.
example.arg: to focus on running the company

roleset.note: Incidentally, that sentences is also a nice illustration of the difference between cause and purpose.

example.name: with causal agent
example.text: She and her husband pulled most of their investments out of the market after the 1987 crash, although she still owns some Texaco stock.
example.arg: although she still owns some Texaco stock

roleset.note: The investments are actually doing the leaving, not "she and her husband".

I feel that Treebank misparsed all of these "pull out of" cases, by making "out of" a complex preposition. The fact is, you don't need to have the "of X" part: "She and her husband pulled out most of their investments." or "...pulled most of their investments out".
